item.title: Integration and Markov Chain Monte Carlo
item.description: Numerical Integration Quadrature “Quadrature rules” are integral approximations which use a finite number of evaluations of the function. All of the quadrature rules below approximate a function using interpolating polynomials. We will first look at some key ideas in numerical integration by approximating definite integrals over a finite interval. We will then extend these ideas to semi-infinite and infinite intervals. We will also consider multiple integrals. In practice we can use Rs integrate function for one-dimensional integrals, and the cubature package for multiple integrals.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD Student under the COMPASS CDT in the Institute for Statistical Science, University of Bristol. Prior to my PhD I completed an integrated master’s degree in Mathematics with Statistics at the University of Bristol. My research interests include: Bayesian methods, High-dimensional statistics, Computational statistics, Graph theory. You can contact me at jake.spiteri@bristol.ac.uk..
